Button styling

Buttons, links and inputs of type "submit" can all be styled to look identical:

Link

There are button styles for each of the semantic colors. Primary is represented by the standard button styling. Classes can be added for: secondary, info, success, warning, and danger.

Each of these button styles has a hover state that is 5% lighter:

Focusing adds a drop-shadow to mimic an outline. It is in the same color family as the outline for non-button links.

Active is slightly darker than the base color, and also has a focus shadow.

Disabled buttons change their pointer and desaturate their background color.

Inputs

Inputs and labels are block elements. They grow like goldfish to fill the container where they live. So create containers of the right size in a row, and fill each with a label and input.

Help text under the label just works:

Legal name only

Find your geolocation and enter it here

Validations errors happen. An error class can be added to the bounding container, which changes the styling of the label help text and input border of that container.

The error class can also be put on individual items within a form.

Must not be blank

Please enter a location
